Hi!
It does not solve the problem at all - u still need to change code and =
recompile it.
You don't need to modify anytning now.
Just make properties f=
ile and put there property:
/JUnitProps.config file:

# This property conta=
ins list of methods to be tested.
#'all' means that u gonna test all method=
 without params that starts with 'test'. Make it default. 
unit.<FQPackageN=
ame>.<test case name>.testList =3D all

And just read this property before =
you run that test case. If the value is 'all'(or it's absent for some reaso=
n) - run all the test cases. If value is a list of method names - make the =
loop and add them to your testSuite. 

Maxim.

----- Original Message -----=
 
  From: Kevin Bourrillion 
  To: 'junit@egroups.com' 
  Sent: Friday, Jan=
uary 19, 2001 11:02 AM
  Subject: RE: [junit] JUnit extension


  That does=
n't satisfy Richard's goal of no recompilation.  I like his idea.  I think =
I'll try it out on my own test runner.
   
  Kevin
   
    -----Original Me=
ssage-----
    From: Johannes Link [mailto:john.link@...]
    Sent: Fri=
day, January 19, 2001 3:45 AM
    To: junit@egroups.com
    Subject: Re: [j=
unit] JUnit extension



    > 3. Run a specific test in a single test-case=
.
    > Solution: Currently I have to modify a suite() method.
    Try:
   =
 junit.textui.TestRunner.run(new MyTestCase("testMethod"));

    Johannes

=
